metadata.description: Optional. Custom name for Action Group.
Optional. Details about the application.
Optional. Custom name for the Automation Account.
Optional. Cost center of owner team. (Default: Contoso-CC)
Optional. Tag value for custom criticality value. (Default: Contoso-Critical)
Optional. criticality of each workload. (Default: Low)
Optional. Determine whether to enable custom naming for the Azure resources. (Default: false)
Optional. Sensitivity of data hosted (Default: Non-business)
Optional. Department that owns the deployment, (Dafult: Contoso-AVD)
Optional. Location where to deploy the tool.
Optional. Input the email distribution list for alert notifications when AIB builds succeed or fail.
Optional. Set to deploy monitoring and alerts for the auto increase automation (Default: false).
Optional. Apply tags on resources and resource groups. (Default: false)
Optional. Deployment environment of the application, workload. (Default: Dev)
Optional. Existing Azure log analytics workspace resource ID to capture runbook execution logs. (Default: )
Optional. Existing Azure log analytics workspace resource ID to capture runbook execution logs. (Default: )
Required. The resource ID for the file share on a Premium Storage Account.
Optional. Custom name for the Log Analytics Workspace.
Optional. Team accountable for day-to-day operations. (Contoso-Ops)
Optional. Organizational owner of the AVD deployment. (Default: Contoso-Owner)
Optional. The amount to increase the file share quota by in GB.
Optional. The threshold in GB that determines when to increase the file share quota.
Optional. Custom name for Resource Group. (Default: rg-avd-use2-shared-services)
Required. AVD shared services subscription ID, multiple subscriptions scenario.
ISO 8601 timestamp used for the deployment names and the Automation runbook schedule.
Optional. Reference to the size of the VM for your workloads (Default: Contoso-Workload)

variables.varAlerts:
[if(parameters('enableMonitoringAlerts'), createArray(createObject('name', 'Azure Files Premium - Share Quota Scaling Failed', 'description', 'Sends an error alert when the runbook fails to execute.', 'severity', 0, 'evaluationFrequency', 'PT5M', 'windowSize', 'PT5M', 'criterias', createObject('allOf', createArray(createObject('query', 'AzureDiagnostics
| where ResourceProvider == "MICROSOFT.AUTOMATION"
| where Category  == "JobStreams"
| where ResultDescription has "Image Template build failed"', 'TimeAggregation', 'Count', 'dimensions', createArray(createObject('name', 'ResultDescription', 'operator', 'Include', 'values', createArray('*'))), 'operator', 'GreaterThanOrEqual', 'threshold', 1, 'failingPeriods', createObject('numberOfEvaluationPeriods', 1, 'minFailingPeriodsToAlert', 1))))), createObject('name', 'Azure Files Premium - Share Quota Increased', 'description', 'Sends an informational alert when the file share quota has increased.', 'severity', 3, 'evaluationFrequency', 'PT5M', 'windowSize', 'PT5M', 'criterias', createObject('allOf', createArray(createObject('query', 'AzureDiagnostics
| where ResourceProvider == "MICROSOFT.AUTOMATION"
| where Category  == "JobStreams"
| where ResultDescription has "New Capacity"', 'TimeAggregation', 'Count', 'dimensions', createArray(createObject('name', 'ResultDescription', 'operator', 'Include', 'values', createArray('*'))), 'operator', 'GreaterThanOrEqual', 'threshold', 1, 'failingPeriods', createObject('numberOfEvaluationPeriods', 1, 'minFailingPeriodsToAlert', 1)))))), createArray())]

metadata.description: Required. The name of the Resource Group.
Optional. Location of the Resource Group. It uses the deployment's location when not provided.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags of the storage account resource.
Optional. The ID of the resource that manages this resource group.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Optional. The name of the lock.
Required. Set lock level.

notes.defaultValue: [if(equals(parameters('level'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Optional. The decription attached to the lock.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the lock.
The resource ID of the lock.
The name of the resource group name the lock was applied to.
The scope this lock applies to.
Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
The name of the resource group.
The resource ID of the resource group.
The location the resource was deployed into.
Required. Name of the Log Analytics workspace.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Service Tier: PerGB2018, Free, Standalone, PerGB or PerNode.
Optional. List of storage accounts to be read by the workspace.
Optional. List of services to be linked.
Conditional. List of Storage Accounts to be linked. Required if 'forceCmkForQuery' is set to 'true' and 'savedSearches' is not empty.
Optional. Kusto Query Language searches to save.
Optional. LAW data export instances to be deployed.
Optional. LAW data sources to configure.
Optional. LAW custom tables to be deployed.
Optional. List of gallerySolutions to be created in the log analytics workspace.
Optional. Number of days data will be retained for.
Optional. The workspace daily quota for ingestion.
Optional. The network access type for accessing Log Analytics ingestion.
Optional. The network access type for accessing Log Analytics query.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Set to 'true' to use resource or workspace permissions and 'false' (or leave empty) to require workspace permissions.
Optional. Specifies the number of days that logs will be kept for; a value of 0 will retain data indefinitely.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of a log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. Indicates whether customer managed storage is mandatory for query management.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed. If left empty, it defaults to "<resourceName>-diagnosticSettings".

Required. Name of the solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution the target solution resource name will be composed as `{name}({logAnalyticsWorkspaceName})`.
Required. Name of the Log Analytics workspace where the solution will be deployed/enabled.
Optional. Location for all resources.

Optional. The product of the deployed solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution it should be `OMSGallery` and the target solution resource product will be composed as `OMSGallery/{name}`. For third party solution, it can be anything. This is case sensitive.
Optional. The publisher name of the deployed solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution, it is `Microsoft`.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the deployed solution.
The resource ID of the deployed solution.
The resource group where the solution is deployed.
The location the resource was deployed into.
Required. The name of the Deployment schedule.
Conditional. The name of the parent Automation Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The operating system to be configured by the deployment schedule.
Required. Reboot setting for the deployment schedule.
Required. The frequency of the deployment schedule. When using 'Hour', 'Day', 'Week' or 'Month', an interval needs to be provided.
Optional. Maximum time allowed for the deployment schedule to run. Duration needs to be specified using the format PT[n]H[n]M[n]S as per ISO8601.
Optional. Update classification included in the deployment schedule.
Optional. KB numbers or Linux packages excluded in the deployment schedule.
Optional. KB numbers or Linux packages included in the deployment schedule.
Optional. Specify the resources to scope the deployment schedule to.
Optional. Specify tags to which to scope the deployment schedule to.
Optional. Enables the scopeByTags to require All (Tag A and Tag B) or Any (Tag A or Tag B).
Optional. Specify locations to which to scope the deployment schedule to.
Optional. Parameters provided to the task running before the deployment schedule.
Optional. The source of the task running before the deployment schedule.
Optional. Parameters provided to the task running after the deployment schedule.
Optional. The source of the task running after the deployment schedule.
Optional. The interval of the frequency for the deployment schedule. 1 Hour is every hour, 2 Day is every second day, etc.
Optional. Enables the deployment schedule.
Optional. Time zone for the deployment schedule. IANA ID or a Windows Time Zone ID.
Optional. Array of functions from a Log Analytics workspace, used to scope the deployment schedule.
Optional. List of azure resource IDs for azure virtual machines in scope for the deployment schedule.
Optional. List of names of non-azure machines in scope for the deployment schedule.
Optional. Required when used with frequency 'Week'. Specified the day of the week to run the deployment schedule.
Optional. Can be used with frequency 'Month'. Provides the specific days of the month to run the deployment schedule.

Optional. Can be used with frequency 'Month'. Provides the pattern/cadence for running the deployment schedule in a month. Takes objects formed like this {occurance(int),day(string)}. Day is the name of the day to run the deployment schedule, the occurance specifies which occurance of that day to run the deployment schedule.

Optional. The start time of the deployment schedule in ISO 8601 format. To specify a specific time use YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS, 2021-12-31T23:00:00. For schedules where we want to start the deployment as soon as possible, specify the time segment only in 24 hour format, HH:MM, 22:00.
Optional. The end time of the deployment schedule in ISO 8601 format. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS, 2021-12-31T23:00:00.
Optional. The expiry time's offset in minutes.
Optional. The next time the deployment schedule runs in ISO 8601 format. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS, 2021-12-31T23:00:00.
Optional. The next run's offset in minutes.
Optional. The schedules description.

Generated. Do not touch. Is used to provide the base time for time comparison for startTime. If startTime is specified in HH:MM format, baseTime is used to check if the provided startTime has passed, adding one day before setting the deployment schedule.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Required. Subtype(s) of the connection to be created. The allowed values depend on the type serviceResourceId refers to.
Optional. The private DNS zone group configuration used to associate the private endpoint with one or multiple private DNS zones. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Required. The name of the Alert.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The description of the scheduled query rule.
Optional. The flag which indicates whether this scheduled query rule is enabled.
Optional. Indicates the type of scheduled query rule.
Optional. The flag that indicates whether the alert should be automatically resolved or not. Relevant only for rules of the kind LogAlert.
Optional. If specified (in ISO 8601 duration format) then overrides the query time range. Relevant only for rules of the kind LogAlert.
Optional. The flag which indicates whether the provided query should be validated or not. Relevant only for rules of the kind LogAlert.

Optional. List of resource type of the target resource(s) on which the alert is created/updated. For example if the scope is a resource group and targetResourceTypes is Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines, then a different alert will be fired for each virtual machine in the resource group which meet the alert criteria. Relevant only for rules of the kind LogAlert.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The list of resource IDs that this scheduled query rule is scoped to.
Optional. Severity of the alert. Should be an integer between [0-4]. Value of 0 is severest. Relevant and required only for rules of the kind LogAlert.
Optional. How often the scheduled query rule is evaluated represented in ISO 8601 duration format. Relevant and required only for rules of the kind LogAlert.
Optional. The period of time (in ISO 8601 duration format) on which the Alert query will be executed (bin size). Relevant and required only for rules of the kind LogAlert.
Optional. Actions to invoke when the alert fires.
Required. The rule criteria that defines the conditions of the scheduled query rule.
Optional. Mute actions for the chosen period of time (in ISO 8601 duration format) after the alert is fired. If set, autoMitigate must be disabled.Relevant only for rules of the kind LogAlert.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
The Name of the created query rule.
The resource ID of the created query rule.
The Resource Group of the created query rule.
The location the resource was deployed into.
